recentChanges: This version fixes an issue with app crashes related to the e-Mail client as well as connectivity problems. We apologize for any inconvenience and hope you like it. Your MindDoc Team
comments: Honestly, this app helped me. A lot. Even though I'm still on the free one, the app helps me to track my condition. With the questions and insight, I feel like I get to to know how I am a little better. The article are easy to understand. Last but not least, kudos to the developer to actually answering my email for help :) thank you. One problem that I got earlier is that sometimes I wrote my journals pretty long, but it didn't saved. But nowadays they're more likely to me saved. I'm loving it.

For me, at this point of my bettering my mental health, the journalling function is the most useful function for me. Occasionally I do read a bit of the learning content which is also beneficial. The journaling function would be easier to use if the plus button was also accessible from the current day. It took me a moment to figure out that if I went to a previous day I could then edit the day to make an additional entry for today. Also some of the content needs further clarification.

Not for Women, but better than nothing...? The app does not let you identify health markers in your profile, like biological sex. Mental health triggers, stimulus, and treatment vary wildly by sex and age, and this app doesn't track or separate that information. As such, your advice and coaching will be given to you as if you were a male of average age. So take it with a grain of salt. The app itself is clean and easy to use. It's just not all that helpful.

A very helpful tool. I've been usng it for over a year and a half. However, I can't use it since the update. My internet is fine, but every time I get on the app, it says a connection isn't possible. I will turn my wi-fi off and back on, and all my other apps work fine. However, this app won't work. It's been a few days now, and the same thing happens. Please fix this soon

This app is really helpful, and I really enjoy tracking how I've been feeling, but the new UI design is awful. It makes it so much harder to find and tag emotions. On the small list, there were only a few negative tags and the other, larger list was so unorganized! It made it annoying to find a tag I wanted. It wasn't even in alphabetical order! Still a great app, but the previous design was much, much better.

title: Borderline Explained the truth about BPD
description:
Borderline personality disorder or BPD affects over 18 million Americans or roughly 6% of the adult population and is arguably the most devastating of all psychiatric disorders.  At the same time, BPD is one of the most stigmatized, misunderstood, and least talked about psychiatric disorders. For many years it was believed that BPD only affected young women. However, we now know that both men and women of all ages are affected with BPD. What makes BPD such a devastating disorder is the high rate of self-injury and suicidal behavior associated with it. With a “death by suicide” rate of roughly 10% it currently has the highest mortality rate of any mental health condition.

The American Psychiatric Association classifies BPD not as a psychiatric disorder but as a personality disorder. A personality disorder is an enduring and pervasive pattern of thinking, feeling, and behaving which deviates markedly from the social norm and causes significant personal distress as well as social and occupational impairment. Personality disorders tend to be treatment resistant, however there are exceptions. 

This app will explore borderline personality disorder including the origin of the disorder, the symptoms, and associated behaviors, the statistics associated with BPD, and the current treatments. Despite what was once believed about BPD being untreatable, we now know that with the proper psychotherapy many people with BPD do get better and even fully recover.

Borderline Explained includes:
•	A comprehensive and detailed description of borderline 
        personality disorder.
•	The A.P.A. official diagnostic criteria for BPD with explanations. 
•	A discussion of the possible cause of BPD
•      Original articles from the developers
•       Articles from experts in the field of psychology and on BPD
•	Borderline personality disorder in men
•	Information on treatments from the Nat’l Institute of Mental 
        Health
•	A discussion of DBT therapy for BPD
•	Detailed statistics on the prevalence, the mortality rate, and other 
        statistics on BPD
•	Celebrities with BPD
•	A self-assessment for BPD
•	Informational videos on BPD
•	An assessment for testing your knowledge about BPD

We are happy to address any concerns you have or respond to your questions regarding BPD or any Psycnet app at, psycnetsolutions@gmail.com

recentChanges: App Privacy Policy
comments: This app is great. It gives great detail of what its like living with BPD and BPD/Bipolar disorder and its posts help us really relate and can better understand better why we act and are the way we are. I haven't experienced any harshness from anyone. The remarks to the posts have been loving and kind, even helpful to some. I just wish my son would take the time to sit down and read what I've sent him or would do some research about it so he'd better understand me so we could get along again.

I love this app, not only is it helping me to gain more knowledge of living with and managing borderline personality disorder. It is simple to use, easy to understand and a great source of information about BPD for non BPD sufferers.

In a relationship with a person afflicted by BPD. This app is a good source of info to help cope with the ups and downs. Some coping strategies provided, would benefit from more in-depth "how to" briefs in setting boundaries in a loving and supportive setting. Overall excellent app. Thank you

After recently suffering a phycotic breakdown, I finally have the correct diagnosis of BPD alongside my ADHD. (previous misdiagnosis of ASD then Bipolar). This app is helping me learn so much about myself and you are a credit to people with BPD, thank you very much
Really well written, makes life a little easier to understand. I don't feel so alone in my disorder now and understand a bit better why I have so many diagnosis

title: Left vs Right: Brain Games for Brain Training
description:
Our games are designed to test your Awareness, Adaptability, Reflex, Reasoning, Precision, and Patience.

Left vs Right includes 51 total games that test and train your brain in one or more of the 6 categories.

Left vs Right has Colorblind Mode! Just activate it in the app's settings menu.

VIP:
VIP members can train all 6 training categories each day. All games from those categories are available. You can additionally play and train individual games an unlimited amount of times each day. Only VIP members can also see Category Brain Quotients, Category Percentiles, and your score history for each game.

Regular:
Regular members can start out training 3 out of 6 categories each day for free. Only regular games from those categories will available. Additionally, you can complete the final 3 daily training games (including VIP games) for free after watching a short video. You can also play individual games using tokens. Regular games cost 1 token. VIP games cost 3 tokens. Additional tokens can only be earned by watching a short video.

Become a VIP member by upgrading your account with one of 4 types of subscriptions:

--7 Day Free Trial* / Weekly Subscription
-- Monthly VIP Subscription
-- Yearly VIP Subscription
-- Lifetime VIP Pass

Prices will vary depending on your country and local currency.

(* PLEASE NOTE: The free trial is a weekly subscription that offers you the first week for free. You must cancel the weekly subscription before the second week if you choose to not renew the weekly subscription.)

Thank you so much for playing!

Now go exercise your brain!

http://www.lvrbrain.com
http://www.twitter.com/lvrbrain
http://www.facebook.com/lvrbrain

recentChanges: Bug fixes
comments: I've tried a lot of brain training games and Left vs Right offers a generous amount of free content without over burdening you with ads. I shall probably invest in the VIP features as these seem good value and it's always encouraging to track your progress over time. As a musician I know that practise makes perfect. 😏

This game is great! I use it mostly every day. And I have notice how much it has helped me already! Its fun but yet educational and you don't even realize how much knowledge you obtain from the short everyday challenges. It has helped me in many ways already! Highly recommend to use daily or at least 3-4 times a week upon downloading. Enjoy!!

It's good but some of the games I can't play. If your colour blind like me and you have to discover what violet looks like. The only way i can do it is to eliminate the ones i can see first and hopefully they will be the last ones. I turned on colour blind mode but I don't know if it worked. It wasnt black and white. Some of the colours were invisible to me.

𝗟𝗢𝗩𝗘 𝗜𝗧! First time I've 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 done a review immediately when asked. I went ahead and got the VIP one time payment and it is already worth the small price. I have been telling people (for years) that playing brain games can help stave off (their own or a loved one's) Alzheimer's and dementia. Now that I'm pushing 50 I'm taking my own advice-this app is perfect for it! Not only are the games fun, you can work targeted areas, track your progress, and see what percentile you are in.🤘

Don't use this app, please. I always try to keep an eye on permissions and this app is very psrsuasive with a message about giving them permission to access your storage. If you go to the app details, permissions area says that is for videos or whatever. If you agree with it, they can manipulate the information from your storage. I didn't play it because of this reason.

title: Mental Well Being
description:
Let us make 2020 is the year to start taking care of our mental health and mental well being. Make 2020 year is the time to heal our soul and mind health.

Mental Health awareness is very crucial these days, take care of your health and your loved one. Mental Health is a level of psychological well-being or an absence of mental illness. there are many factors that contributes to mental health, such as life experience, biological factor and social / environment factors which included in this app.

Know what symptoms you have about major depression and anxiety disorder. Know what should you do if you're having the early symptoms about depression or anxiety and prevent it from getting worst. Being mentally ill doesn't mean you can't be treated. Please never think of that, psychiatric is there to help as well as counseling service. Let go of the stigma about mental illness and don't give up on yourself. Do something about our health care.

This app is just a simple guide for understanding mental health , depression and anxiety. If you're having the symptoms, please read our guide on how to select your psychiatrist or counselor . Do not feel discriminated about having mental disorder, as it can be treated. 

categories in this app:
- what is mental health and type of mental disorder , ex : bipolar disorder etc.
-what causes mental fitness / mental illness
-early warning signs of mental illness
-what are the symptoms of mental illness
-how to help people with mental health
-how to prevent mental illness to maintain good mental health

Please practice good self care and self love . 

* mental illness are more common than cancer, diabetes or heart disease, its just that people tend to ignore their mind health.

title: PD Test - Personality Disorders Test
description:
Only English language supported.
This test helps understand which personality disorders characterize you. Even if you don't suffer from a personality disorder, your personality can feature some traits of personality disorders. A personality disorder is a set of traits that negatively characterize your life. They can have different causes and many are easier to treat than others.

This test will analyze your answers to recognize the presence or tendency to ten different disorders:
• Paranoid
• Schizoid
• Schizotypal
• Antisocial
• Borderline
• Histrionic
• Narcissistic
• Avoidant
• Dependant
• Obsessive-Compulsive

THIS TEST IS NOT A DIAGNOSTIC TOOL: the purpose of this test is to make aware of aspects of one's personality often hidden.
Remember, try to answer honestly or the test results will not reflect reality!

Features:
1. 10 different types of questions: 10~20 min.
2. Saving test results.
3. Description of each test result.
4. Possibility to translate parts of the test to increase linguistic coverage.
5. Relax with a relaxing music.

recentChanges: Stability improvement.
comments: Did this just for fun as I have been diagnosed with multiple things. It detected the Borderline Personality Disorder, but let's be real, that isn't difficult at all. It also diagnosed me with something I have never heard of (and now wish I had written down as I have uninstalled the app already) because it was so far off of my personality indicating that I did extreme things to achieve affection and felt useless without their attentions. Very far off ;) just for fun, enjoyed, now done ;)

some of the questions were worded a bit off like they didn't make a lot of sense or grammar was so far off I was unsure what they were asking. also a personal issue I kept forgetting the scale value like of 1 was most or least true so if app creators want to cater to us absent minded people and put it on each page 😏 otherwise fellow absent minders right it down right, I know took me 3 times but I figured out the "cheat" lmao

the test was okay but the instructions are covered by a big continue sign or next so I scored the questions incorrectly and had to take the test over again. they need to remove the sign that covers the instructions on the first home screen. otherwise the test was fine and the results I'm not too sure about

Limited questions. Limitation in judgment and diagnosis. Not adequate details as enough for different cases. Not true results for all cases. In one word = It's a limited database and AI engine so it has not proper results. It's not bad but needs to have more improvements also it has not complete trusted results.
It may take some time to complete the test but the end result is quite interesting. It tells you your score and there you can see what you can work on to try to be better

title: BetterHelp: Online Counseling & Therapy
description:
BetterHelp is the convenient way to get professional help from licensed therapists and counselors online. 
With over 10,000 trained, experienced and accredited counselors covering a range of areas – from depression and anxiety to family and couples therapy – it’s never been easier to receive personal, professional help when you need it. 

-------------------------------------------
BETTERHELP – FEATURES
-------------------------------------------
⦁ Over 10,000 counselors & therapists covering a wide variety of specializations including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral therapy (DBT), and more
⦁ Fight stress - improve your mental health and mood with e therapy
⦁ Get professional help with depression, panic and anxiety attacks, obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd), ptsd, or any other mental illness you may be dealing with
⦁ All counselors are licensed, trained, accredited and highly experienced
⦁ Match with an available counselor best fit for your needs
⦁ Unlimited private one on one communication with your therapist
⦁ Schedule live sessions with your counselor or use the secure messenger
⦁ Gain access to constructive, educational group webinars
⦁ Fight the stigma of mental illness by getting help from someone who cares

PROFESSIONAL HELP, PERSONALIZED FOR YOU
Facing mental health obstacles alone can be daunting – receiving support and guidance from a professional counselor has been shown to make huge, positive changes to help you overcome personal challenges. 

Among other things, BetterHelp can provide support with:
Depression
Anxiety
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
Panic Attacks
Bipolar and Mood Disorders
Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
Social Anxiety

LICENSED AND TRAINED COUNSELORS & THERAPISTS
There are over 10,000 counselors in BetterHelp, each with at least 3 years and 2,000 hours of hands-on experience. They are licensed, trained, experienced and accredited psychologists (PhD/PsyD), marriage and family therapists (MFT), clinical social workers (LCSW), licensed professional counselors (LPC), or similar credentials. 

All of our therapists have a Master’s Degree or a Doctorate Degree in their respective field. They have been qualified and certified by their state professional board by completing the necessary education, exams, training and practice. 

HOW DOES IT WORK?
You and your counselor will get your own secure “room”. This will be your private place to communicate day or night. You can access this room from any internet connected device, wherever you are. 

You can write about yourself, the things going on in your life, ask questions and discuss the challenges you’re facing. Your counselor will login to the same room and respond with feedback, insights and guidance. 

Together you’ll work towards making a positive change in your life, accomplishing your goals and overcoming your problems. 

HOW MANY SESSIONS CAN I HAVE?
You aren’t limited to a certain number of messages (“sessions”). The frequency of your sessions depends on your availability and the interaction between you and your counselor. You may prefer to have 3-4 short interactions per week, or 1 long and thorough session. You can use the service as much or as little as you like, depending on your needs.

YOU DESERVE TO BE HAPPY.

WE ARE HERE TO HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN – DOWNLOAD BETTERHELP TODAY!

BETTERHELP – FEATURES
-------------------------------------------
⦁ Over 10,000 counselors & therapists covering a wide variety of specializations including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral therapy (DBT), and more
⦁ Fight stress - improve your mental health and mood with e therapy
⦁ Get professional help with depression, panic and anxiety attacks, obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd), ptsd, or any other mental illness you may be dealing with
⦁ All counselors are licensed, trained, accredited and highly experienced
⦁ Match with an available counselor best fit for your needs
⦁ Unlimited private one on one communication with your therapist
⦁ Schedule live sessions with your counselor or use the secure messenger
⦁ Gain access to constructive, educational group webinars
⦁ Fight the stigma of mental illness by getting help from someone who cares

PROFESSIONAL HELP, PERSONALIZED FOR YOU
Facing mental health obstacles alone can be daunting – receiving support and guidance from a professional counselor has been shown to make huge, positive changes to help you overcome personal challenges.

Among other things, BetterHelp can provide support with:
Depression
Anxiety
Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
Panic Attacks
Bipolar and Mood Disorders
Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
Social Anxiety

LICENSED AND TRAINED COUNSELORS & THERAPISTS
There are over 10,000 counselors in BetterHelp, each with at least 3 years and 2,000 hours of hands-on experience. They are licensed, trained, experienced and accredited psychologists (PhD/PsyD), marriage and family therapists (MFT), clinical social workers (LCSW), licensed professional counselors (LPC), or similar credentials.

All of our therapists have a Master’s Degree or a Doctorate Degree in their respective field. They have been qualified and certified by their state professional board by completing the necessary education, exams, training and practice.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
You and your counselor will get your own secure “room”. This will be your private place to communicate day or night. You can access this room from any internet connected device, wherever you are.

You can write about yourself, the things going on in your life, ask questions and discuss the challenges you’re facing. Your counselor will login to the same room and respond with feedback, insights and guidance.

Together you’ll work towards making a positive change in your life, accomplishing your goals and overcoming your problems.

HOW MANY SESSIONS CAN I HAVE?
You aren’t limited to a certain number of messages (“sessions”). The frequency of your sessions depends on your availability and the interaction between you and your counselor. You may prefer to have 3-4 short interactions per week, or 1 long and thorough session. You can use the service as much or as little as you like, depending on your needs.

YOU DESERVE TO BE HAPPY.

WE ARE HERE TO HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN – DOWNLOAD BETTERHELP TODAY!
summary: Get counseling from a licensed therapist, manage and improve your mental health
recentChanges: Thank you for using BetterHelp! We are constantly improving our app and delivering enhancements to the App Store. Every update is a boost to the app's stability, speed, and security.
comments: I like the convenience of the app and makes counseling way more accessible than traditional counseling. I took off one star just because the questions you answer before getting matched with a counselor don't seem to matter; I asked for a female counselor and immediately got matched with a male counselor. But it's easy to switch counselors if you don't mesh well with one and the variety of communication options is great.

I love having access to a counselor without having to go into an office. It helps to have someone to message when you are actually going through something and the flexibility of taking at any time. Sometimes it takes a few hours to hear back, but good just the same. Definitely recommend of you've been thinking about starting a counselor about anything.

You get what you pay for! The UI is nice, the app works well. But the therapists seem very disconnected and don't really seem to care much at all, responding in broken or incomplete sentences. Perhaps I just got unlucky with my matches, but my experience wasn't very good. I'm making more progress on my mental health by just journaling and meditating.

Okay, so I tried this app 4 years ago and the councelor I was given was terrible at responding to me. So I gave it up after the free trial. So I come back again for anxiety, and I guess I didn't read well enough and clicked a payment option. Holy cow! What they took out of my account was way more than expected, and I didn't have much anyways! But there isn't a phone number to call, it's an email. So congrats on making my anxiety worse!! They better give me my money back cuz I didn't use the app

I would rate it five stars if it wasn't for the audio on the app. The audio didn't work for me when I had to use my phone to have a session with my counselor. I couldn't hear her but she could hear me. I have an Android, I tried to maximize my volume, even tried putting on headphones and tinker with the different volume settings, but didn't work still.

title: Personality Disorder Test
description:
The Personality Disorder Test app is an entertaining and educational psychology based app. The app is based in both the fields of psychology and psychiatry and involves the subject of personality disorders and personality traits. Psychology and psychiatry currently recognize ten clinical personality disorders. These include narcissistic personality disorder, borderline personality disorder, schizoid personality disorder, paranoid personality disorder and others.  

This app presents the user with a series of 80 brief multiple choice questions in the form of agree/disagree/neutral.  The embedded test takes about 10 minutes to complete and is very easy to understand.  

Upon completion of the test the user is presented with a detailed chart describing which of the 10 personality disorders the user has the most in common with and therefore possesses the most traits of that particular disorder. It also informs the user which disorders he is least like. 

Although based in the legitimate sciences of psychiatry and psychology the test is not meant to be a diagnostic tool. It does however provide some “food for thought” and make for an interesting exercise.

So are you more of a narcissist? or do you lean towards being histrionic or borderline?

Do you have schizoid traits? or are you more of a schizotypal? 

Well now you can find out just how eccentric you actually are and where you lean when it comes to psychiatry's classification of personality disorders.

If you have comments or questions regarding the app feel free to contact us at psycnetsolutions@gmail.com

summary: This app is designed to test an individual for a personality disorder
recentChanges: Several bug fixes applied
comments: I don't think I need seeing psychologist, but I totally agree with my results. Also, I liked the description of each disorder, how they clarify this app isn't a diagnosis and you should see a professional if those traits affect too much your life.

This test was very accurate, as long as your honest. I have been diagnosed with borderline personality disorder. I did the test and I had three. I would suggest anyone that might want to know to do this test.

Upon a search of "disorder", within the top 10 results I see 3 "psycnet" apps, of which one of them is #1 result. While the information is good, (atleast the offline content), it is regurgitated from other sources. The layout of each app is identical, however the icon images on download screen seem "too" unique, thereby concealing the relationship until further examination. Its a tad creepy, considering the online "tests" and information stored from within the apps.

I've been diagnosed,beginning at a young age,with mental health disorders.Although I enjoy taking online tests such as this,for the most part the results are not indicative of my diagnosis.THIS PARTICULAR SCREENING TEST was extremely accurate, so much so that my first thought(I found myself lmao)was I could have saved innumerable visits and time if only 30 years ago this app had been available for me to stumbled upon. Absolutely "On Point"Terrific job devs. Check it out,thank me later, lol.

The test knew exactly what I have. I'm a psych student and I have a personality disorder, so I thought I'd see if the app would guess right. I answered honestly and found myself thinking that because I'm medicated and so mentally healthy right now it wouldn't pick up on it. But when I got to the end, that BPD bar was the only blip and it was sticking straight out. So unless everyone else also got BPD, I'd say this is pretty realistic. Still, I wouldn't rely on this for a diagnosis.

title: Psychosis Disorder
description: Psychosis is an abnormal condition of the mind that involves a loss of contact with reality. People experiencing psychosis may exhibit personality changes and thought disorder. Depending on its severity, this may be accompanied by unusual or bizarre behavior, as well as difficulty with social interaction and impairment in carrying out daily life activities. Psychosis as a sign of a psychiatric disorder is a diagnosis of exclusion. That is, a new-onset episode of psychosis is not considered a symptom of a psychiatric disorder until other relevant and known causes of psychosis are properly excluded. Medical and biological laboratory tests should exclude central nervous system diseases and injuries, diseases and injuries of other organs, psychoactive substances, and toxins as causes of symptoms of psychosis before any psychiatric illness can be diagnosed. In medical training, psychosis as a sign of illness is often compared to fever since both can have multiple causes that are not readily apparent.

summary: Psychosis is abnormal condition of involves a loss of contact with reality.

title: Depression: The Game
description:
Depression: The Game goes in depth about the struggles of a depressed individual. It tackles the characteristics of someone who's diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder or Depression.

This game is especially beneficial for those who know people with this mental-illness, as it gives an in-depth point of view of someone diagnosed with it.

The theme of this game is puzzle. You are tasked with a multitude of puzzles, which require logic and emotional-intelligence.

Depression is a constant feeling of sadness, often accompanied by emotions, such as hopelessness and despair. you. Depression isn't merely sadness. It is more than just sadness. Depression changes how you think, feel, and function in daily activities. Depression can interfere with your ability to work, study, eat, sleep, and enjoy life.

Some symptoms of depression are (and not limited to):

Feelings of helplessness and hopelessness. 

Loss of interest in daily activities.

Appetite or weight changes. 

Sleep changes.

Anger or irritability.

Reckless behavior.

summary: Depression: The Game is a puzzle game that goes in depth about being depressed.
recentChanges: Update (fixed 3.0).
comments: Horrible game designed by someone who has no respect, empathy, or understanding for people who genuinely experience depression. The game offers nonsensical solutions to generic descriptions of how someone might describe their depression. Figures but I gave it the benefit of the doubt and not only did the game live up to its criticisms but the ads ruin its playability entirely. It's insulting tapping for a hint to see it for a nanosecond before an ad pops up preventing you from reading the hint.

This feels like a soulless cashgrab, made to keep people watching ads. Most of the tasks are so convoluted, that I found myself pressing hint every time. For people with depression, like myself, this app is terrible at helping anyone through it. The people/person responsible for this, has no heart.

Pretty mediocre. One of the puzzles didn't work for me regardless of me doing what the hint said to do, and the barrage of ads on the hints leave a bad taste in my mouth. Sometimes it'll only play an ad and no hint. Sucks because this had potential.

Annoying as hell! Definitely makes me feel trapped like depression, great on that, but anytime i click 'hint' cause i can't get passed, all I'm met with is an ad for 30 seconds and can't read the actual hint that flashes on the screen for like half a milisecond!

Very unique. This game describes how depression feels and i belive thats a great way to show people who dont quite understand how it feels. Each level is seemingly a challange but then agsin depression is as well. Good job compairing it to a puzzle because depression can take a while to figure out and piece together. As someone who can relate to being in depression you did a good job making each level a bit difficult to represent how hard it is in real life. Cool game. Would recomend. 10/10.

title: Thinkladder - Self-awareness & Mental Wellness
description:
Thinkladder is a collaboration of mental health professionals, creatives, contributors, and developers that have teamed together to provide you with a beautiful self-discovery journey.

Thinkladder is a guide that helps link symptoms to underlying limiting beliefs and then offers the opportunity to challenge those beliefs with insights collated by our mental health professionals.

With Thinkladder, you can set reminders to help you build new thought patterns centred around the relevant insights that you have discovered.

Just like you, Thinkladder is growing. At the moment, you can explore themes including:

Social / Physical Distancing
Loss of Job
Perfectionism
Correction & Criticism
People Pleasing
I Must Be Dumb
Comparing Myself to Others
Self-Worth
Compassion Fatigue
Anxiety
Anger
Body Image
Startups and Founders

Some recent reviews:

"...thank you for developing such an invaluable app. As a self-help app, I really appreciate how it provides a plethora of helpful, positive self-affirmations to select, in order to try and replace the negative ones with. Other self-help apps ask the user to provide their own alternative affirmations, which I find that can be an impossible task - if one is so steeped in unhelpful, negative thoughts, feelings and perspectives about one's self. Everyone - no matter who they are - have doubts and insecurities about themselves selves and therefore, I feel this app is beneficial for all..."

"I love love love this app! I just discovered it, but I've been looking a long time for an app to help me cope with social anxiety/perfectionism/low self esteem... It really helps me understand my feelings and try to confront them head on!"

Self-Worth
Compassion Fatigue
Anxiety
Anger
Body Image
Startups and Founders

Some recent reviews:

"...thank you for developing such an invaluable app. As a self-help app, I really appreciate how it provides a plethora of helpful, positive self-affirmations to select, in order to try and replace the negative ones with. Other self-help apps ask the user to provide their own alternative affirmations, which I find that can be an impossible task - if one is so steeped in unhelpful, negative thoughts, feelings and perspectives about one's self. Everyone - no matter who they are - have doubts and insecurities about themselves selves and therefore, I feel this app is beneficial for all..."

"I love love love this app! I just discovered it, but I've been looking a long time for an app to help me cope with social anxiety/perfectionism/low self esteem... It really helps me understand my feelings and try to confront them head on!"
summary: Join thousands who are embarking on a self-awareness journey with Thinkladder
developerAddress:
The IceHouse
Level 4, The Textile Centre
117-125 Saint Georges Bay Rd
Parnell
Auckland
New Zealand
recentChanges:
This update brings you a fresh Theme to cover isolation, unexpected change, information overload, social responsibility, loss of plans, and loneliness.
It also includes other bug fixes and performance improvements.
comments: This app has been really helpful in the mornings for me. It gives me a positive affirmation/reminder for the day. Its interesting to go through a negative belief that you may have and that it makes you challenge that negative thought with a positive one. Dear developers: I think a search bar or something similar could be very helpful! A way to type in the specific feeling or thought you're having and being able to get relating affirmations from the keywords that you enter in. :)

Unlike most of the mental health/CBT apps out there, this one actually has content (more than just "Describe the thought and bodily sensation, then come up with a positive response"). If you want some constructive reframing without the cutesy cartoon animals, Thinkladder's got you. Only way to make it better would be more content (but you guys are still working on that update, right?) Thanks for a great app!
If only it would continue the content where it was left it would be perfect.(when pressing back bottom)
Insights for one of the options are just...not there. It's a blank page. Not a very promising introduction to using the app.

This app is invaluable to help you examine negative self thoughts, feelings & perspectives & replace them with helpful ones.Unlike other self-help apps - which require you to generate your own positive alternatives - it provides the positive alternatives for you. This is why I feel the app is invaluable: if you are entrenched in negative thoughts & feelings about your self, it can feel impossible to generate a helpful, alternative thought for your self. I'm grateful to all that devised this app.

Great app. Should update the Complucated Grief Disorder, and perhaps quizzes once in a while. I'm a lucky participant of BPD; this app helps me recognize the truths of my illness, as well as others I meet. So glad i found this app.

This app is great! its good for learning about other things and works great. its works especially well if your doing a school prodject on mental disorders and you need lots of info. this appvis great and would definetely recommend!

great app for gaining a basic understanding of mental health disorders which is so important in the lives and people we meet. I also use it as a reference working as a nurse.

title: My Story:  An Autobiography of Schizophrenia
description: An Autobiography and battle with schizophrenia from a young male Asian perspective. Read the story of an aspiring novelist who has had so many problems in life but overcome them-from victim to victor. This is the life story of Zahid Zaman, sometimes, fun, sometimes sad , sometimes enlightening but always interesting, read how a young male Asian battle with schizophrenia and life to come out on top.

Its very unique, and just like most game there is a few bugs like the water balloons being dropped at people below, it will stick to my character's hand and wont drop. Very good game. But when i go to stats for example it says 15 hours left. And i look at it the next day and it says 5 days left. I dont know why is this happening.

This game's awesome, it's simplicity and how relatable it is are great. I would love that the player could buy even more things, maybe a different kind of bed or something. I really appreciate the efforts of the developers :)

I really really like this game, there are no random ads and strategically lets you watch them to gain something actually useful and it doesn't take alot of effort, it's simple and its good, its worth playing plus it has that slavic representation which i live for as a slavic person. I cant explain it but this game is charming and really fun

title: Rétablissement & schizophrénie
description:
Destinée aux patients atteints de schizophrénie, à leur famille ou à leurs aidants, l'application "Rétablissement et schizophrénie" donne des informations conformes aux recommandations internationales sur la prise en charge de la schizophrénie et le parcours de soins proposé aux patients.

L'application "Rétablissement et schizophrénie" explique le principe de rétablissement dans la schizophrénie et les moyens à mettre en œuvre pour y parvenir. Elle décrit ainsi les différentes étapes pour tendre vers une disparition des symptômes et un retour au fonctionnement antérieur à l'apparition de la maladie. 
Elle aborde aussi de manière très concrète les difficultés (addictions, relations famille / patient) rencontrées au cours de l'évolution de la maladie. Elle donne des conseils pour vivre au mieux au quotidien avec un diagnostic de schizophrénie.
Enfin, elle donne une information complète et accessible sur les causes de la schizophrénie et sur les traitements pharmacologiques.

Enfin, elle donne une information complète et accessible sur les causes de la schizophrénie et sur les traitements pharmacologiques.
summary: Explains the medical and psychosocial journey to recover from schizophrenia

title: UCSF PRIME
description:
The ultimate goal of PRIME is to inspire young people with schizophrenia to improve quality of life. PRIME includes social networking with relatable peers, goal setting focused on promoting well being, and access to mental health motivational coaches to support users in improving their lives. PRIME was developed at the UCSF, DRIVE lab in collaboration with IDEO, the global design firm, Wolox software boutique, and with individuals with schizophrenia and their family members. Clinical trials for the use of PRIME and its effects on improving quality of life are underway. 
Only our clinical trial participants can use PRIME. Please email roam@umn.edu to determine your eligibility to participate in the PRIME studies.

title: TalkLife for Anxiety, Depression & Stress
description:
TalkLife is all about support. Our community is full of people who have also felt alone, battled depression or living with anxiety and needed somewhere safe to talk. TalkLife is a positive community where people have real conversations about how they feel - lonely, misunderstood, unhappy, or actually feeling alright. 

People use TalkLife to seek support for the bad times, but also celebrate the good ones. You, your thoughts, your feelings are important - don't keep them bottled up. You can even vent anonymously. 

You may feel bad now, but you're not alone, and there are better times ahead. TalkLife is here for you through the shiny and the muck, and they can really lift you. Download TalkLife and say hello. 

Download TalkLife and you can safely talk about any struggles and reach support across many areas including, anxiety, self-harm, living with depression, self harm, loneliness, PTSD, bipolar, suicidal thoughts, and many more. 

*Please note, if you are in a crisis situation, please seek emergency support as soon as possible. Peer support should not be used if you are in an emergency situation.

recentChanges:
+ Added the ability to filter groups by topic.
+ Fixed lag loading on public group settings page.
+ Fixed crash on public groups.
+ Fixed notification drop down.
+ Fixed a few bugs & crashes.
comments: I've only been on for a less than an hour and I uninstalled. I can't stand the creepy/inappropriate comments. Honestly made me feel worse. The ads are annoying and the filters are so limited. I want to filter based on country and multiple age groups. I do not like how all the categories are merged together on my feed. I wanted to find a safe space to escape the toxicity on other social media sites and this is just as bad.

For the moment, you can actually converse with people. It's not flooded with bots, OF/IG farmers, or the casual hook-up crowd. There are edgelords, but for the moment.... It's great. Said after spending 10+ hours of near continual usage on the app. Further, in that time the mods/admins were active in discussing community issues, and pending changes in an open posting. Refreshing, and grateful that I stumbled across TalkLife. Keep it secret, keep it safe. ;)

Few things annoy me about it (full page ads every so often, not non stop though but they are hard to exit out of), can't quickly scroll to the top of a page and can't set unique backgrounds for a post. All in all though, a good, helpful app!

I'm using this app for 5 months and it helped me in a lot way, like making friends, taking care of my mental health and helping people. And the new update is so cool. Especially the groups we can moderate our own group and publicize it. So happy to see a community growing and being a part of it.

Im not saying this is a replacement for seeing a psychiatrist. But for peoplelike me sometimes its good to express yourself in a healthy way and receive support. This app honestly helped me stop crying and smile for the first time in a long time.

title: Mental illness - Treatment
description:
We often encounter people who are in bad shape, dirty clothes and strange behavior. Many people feel very frightened when approaching them. They call them "madmen." They are scientifically referred to as psychotic patients with mental illnesses or disorders. 
Symptoms of mental illness
There are many general symptoms that appear on people with mental illness:

    Act strange and surprising around him with his abnormal behaviors.
    Not knowing what is going on around him, such as time and time, since he does not care about time and does not feel it.
    Not caring for himself in general, and his personal cleanliness in particular.
    Loss of awareness of what he does he does not know why he behaves this way or what to do.
    May do some dangerous behavior on himself and on others, and can exceed the other words or already.
    Hearing and seeing things that are unreal and exist only in his mind, which leads him to speak with fictional characters.

Types of mental illness

There are many mental illnesses that can be divided into several types based on the main causes of this mental illness:

    Organic diseases resulting from a problem in the brain, such as imbalance in the brain and its cells.
    Functional diseases As a body member is unable to function normally.
    Toxic diseases, such as poisoning in some organs of the body as a result of the treatment of toxic substances.
    Mental illness may be caused by a deficiency in the amount of certain vitamins in the body, or a lack of mineral salts.
    Diseases associated with external causes, such as a strong blow to the head, causing concussion, sunburn, or various types of drugs or alcohol.
    Mental illness in children, due to problems during pregnancy.

Examples of mental illness

    Schizophrenia.
    Obsession.
    Bipolar disorder, characterized by two directions in which either joy and excessive movement and feeling euphoria, or severe depression.


The mental illness is characterized by the existence of disorders, mental illness characterized by the existence of psychotic disorders, and the mental patient is different from the mental patient that he is a scientist in his condition and that he is sick and does not imitate the characters, and his behavior is acceptable, and hallucination scare And the behavior of a person is not very clear. It is not socially acceptable, and it is often the hallucination that he lives and believes as if he reality .



Mental illness

Medical conditions involving changes in emotion, behavior, and thinking are referred to as Mental Illnesses. These diseases are associated with problems, difficulties in social, family or work activities, and mental or mental illnesses As treatable.
Types of mental illness

There are some types of mental illness, including the following:

    Anxiety.
    Late dysfunction.
    Autism disorder.
    Schizophrenia.
    Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.
    Personality Disorders.
    Obsessive-compulsive disorder.
    Multiple eating disorders, such as anorexia, or bulimia.
    Dual diagnosis.
    Personality disorders schizophrenia.
    Seasonal Affective Disorder.
    Bipolar disorder.
    Tourette syndrome.
    Attention deficit, hyperactivity.
    Panic disorder, or panic attacks.
    Depression.

title: Psychology Interactive Textbook, MCQ & Test Bank
description:
Psychology is designed to meet scope and sequence requirements for the single-semester introduction to psychology course. The book offers a comprehensive treatment of core concepts, grounded in both classic studies and current and emerging research. The text also includes coverage of the DSM-5 in examinations of psychological disorders. Psychology incorporates discussions that reflect the diversity within the discipline, as well as the diversity of cultures and communities across the globe.



* Complete Textbook by OpenStax
* Multiple Choices Questions (MCQ)
* Essay Questions Flash Cards
* Key-Terms Flash Cards

Powered by QuizOver.com the leading online quiz creator 
https://www.quizover.com

title: CBT Thought Diary - Mood Tracker, Journal & Record
description:
Do you feel like you're always stressed, anxious, sad, frustrated, or unmotivated? The centerpiece of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is learning to identify negative and distorted thinking patterns to change your emotions and your behaviors for the better. In CBT, a "thought record" guides you through the steps of identifying, challenging, and reinterpreting negative thinking patterns. With Thought Diary, you can document your negative emotions, analyze flaws in your thinking, and re-evaluate your negative thoughts into more balanced ones. It may even help you recognize helpful ways to deal with your negative behaviors and emotions for future situations.

CBT Thought Diary can do more than thought records, though! It can also be used as a daily mood tracker. You can even practice gratitude by creating positive entries using our flexible diary entry format. According to positive psychology, appreciating the positives in our lives can improve happiness and meaning.
 
With CBT Thought Diary, you can gradually change your approach to how you interpret the ups and downs of life, making long-lasting changes in your mental well-being.

According to positive psychology, practicing gratitude and recording positive emotions is important as well. Thought Diary also allows you to keep track of your positive experiences so that you can refer back to them and appreciate the good moments, as well as note down what particular things you're grateful for. This way, you can be more aware and thankful of the positive moments in life.

Thought Diary will help you evaluate, understand, and change your thoughts and feelings. By using this application, you can work to identify your emotions, analyze how and why you're feeling this way, challenge those negative beliefs, change your thinking patterns for future situations, and remember positive experiences. You can use this app as a mood journal, a thought record journal, and a gratitude journal.

Thought Records and Gratitude Journals similar to this app are commonly used in paper form in traditional cognitive-behavioral therapy for a variety of mental health disorders such as clinical depression and anxiety. If you are suffering from a mental health disorder, please consult a mental health professional or healthcare provider. 

Privacy Policy: https://cbtthoughtdiary.com/privacypolicy

Terms Of Service: https://cbtthoughtdiary.com/termsofservice

comments: I absolutely adore this app! The way it lays out each step for when you're feeling happy or sad helps you rationalize your thoughts in an easy way. The flexibility to add smaller entries, like mood, minor journal entries or full daily entries is welcomed. The only complaint is the pro edition costs WAY too much ($30/ yr) when the free edition already has more than enough. It's one of the best CBT apps out there, would highly recommend!

I downloaded this app with low expectations but I've been so pleasantly surprised at how amazing it is. The interface is simple and clean, helps you organize things very flexibly and I really love the "Check Thought" feature that allows you analyze how a negative thought may have a contortion and helps you find your wisdom in challenging the thought. 15/10 would recommend ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

this app is really good to have on hand. My friend uses this app frequently and recommended it to me. I may only use it once a month or so but catching that thought and being able to break it down in easy steps is really helpful. It's also makes it easier to go back and remind yourself of those descions and the thought process, highly recommend.

I like the simplicity of the app. It's not overwhelming to look at. The layout makes it easy to use. I would give it 5 stars, but I feel that an app helping teach CBT skills through journaling should have more features available without needing a premium version.

A good app for keeping track of your thoughts and worries. The only detraction is that some features are locked behind a premium service. Since using the app I have been able to keep better track of my mood and thoughts as well as notice patterns in my behaviours I wouldn't have otherwise. A great choice for anyone utilizing CBT or anyone looking to gain a better understanding of themselves

title: Narcissistic Personality Disorder
description:
The hallmarks of narcissist with a Narcissistic Personality Disorder (NPD) are grandiosity, a lack of empathy for other people, and a need for admiration. People with this condition are frequently described as arrogant, self-centered, manipulative, and demanding. 
They may also concentrate on grandiose fantasies (e.g. their own success, beauty, brilliance) and may be convinced that they deserve special treatment. These characteristics typically begin in early adulthood and must be consistently evident in multiple contexts, such as at work and in relationships.
Narcissists are People with narcissistic personality disorder believe they are superior or special, and often try to associate with other people they believe are unique or gifted in some way. This association enhances their self-esteem, which is typically quite fragile underneath the surface. 
Individuals with NPD seek excessive admiration and attention in order to know that others think highly of them. Individuals with narcissistic personality disorder have difficulty tolerating criticism or defeat, and may be left feeling humiliated or empty when they experience an "injury" in the form of criticism or rejection.
Narcissistic Personality Disorder Features:
•	Narcissist Definition.
•	What is Narcissistic Personality Disorder.
•	Narcissistic Personality Disorder. 
•	Signs and symptoms of narcissistic.
•	Narcissistic Personality Treatment.

Narcissistic Personality Disorder is different than schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, borderline personality disorder, anxiety and bipolar because Narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) is closely associated with egocentrism, a personality characteristic in which people see themselves and their interests and opinions as the only ones that really matter.

title: Medical Psychiatric Dictionary
description:
Ultimate offline & free Psychiatric Dictionary with complete list of mental disorders, psychiatric diseases and symptoms.

Medical Psychiatric Dictionary App Features:
- Works Offline. A fully functional offline medical dictionary free without internet requirement after first download.
- A pocket hand book for quick reference.
- Frequent updates on latest psychiatric diseases, symptoms, new medical acronyms and abbreviations.
- Psychiatric nursing book free for nursing practitioners and psychiatric meds.
- A medical learning app for self diagnosis and treatment. For use by learners and doctor students while study during various courses/ examination, tests, PG preparation.

Uses:
* This is a thesaurus and dictionary on psychiatry reference.
* Also a general purpose medical term dictionary.
* Useful for students for study during medical pg entrance courses and psychiatry quiz.
* Can be used by healthcare students, pharmaceuticals, physicians, nursing professionals, pharmacy assistants and students who work in clinical practice & dispensary.

This Psychiatry app is for learning, diagnosis and prevention of mental disorders & problems that hinder mental health and well being.

DISCLAIMER:
This app cannot and should not replace a doctor consultation or a pharmacist. Only for pocket reference & educational purposes. Consult a doctor before actual home usage of any information in this app.

title: Mental Health Recovery Guide
description:
There are 17 essential things you need to know to fast track your recovery from mental illness. The Mental Health Recovery Guide (MHRG) will tell you what they are.

If you suffer from depression, schizophrenia or bipolar disorder, and if you are a mental health outpatient, or a newly discharged psychiatric in-patient at the UK’s NHS or elsewhere in the world, MHRG will help you to get well and stay well.

The app is not just for the UK’s NHS patients but for the whole family of mental health sufferers everywhere. To date, it has been downloaded by users from 30 COUNTRIES around the world.

• BEST INFORMATION & ADVICE FROM THE NHS & OTHER LEADERS
The app contains the most up-to-date evidence-based treatment, advice, support and self-help remedies that have proven to be successful with patients around the world, and that you can do yourself, without the need for a doctor. 

All of MHRG’s featured information and advice has been obtained directly from the world’s leading healthcare institutions, including the NHS, the World Health Organisation, the European Food Standards Authority, the Royal College of Psychiatrists, the New England Journal of Medicine and King’s College London.

• SIMPLE TREATMENT REMEDIES YOU CAN DO YOURSELF
All of the Mental Health Recovery Guide’s advice is simple, and even fun. For example, how can dancing help with depression, or other forms of mental illness? How much water should you drink to improve your mental health? These and other questions are answered within our alternative guide to healing and self-betterment.

Other healthcare topics cover diet, exercise, vitamins, positive thinking and love.

• ‘SUPER VIEW’ OFFERS EXPANDED ADVICE, SUPPORT & TREATMENT
The Mental Health Recovery Guide’s 17 essentials are conveyed via a scrolling sequence of short, simple sentences. For deeper learning, each sentence is hyperlinked to a ‘super view’ — a connecting page featuring more detailed advice, support and self-help treatment options. As you scroll through the app, simply tap any sentence to access it. Super view is updated monthly with the latest treatment research results from around the world.

• A DAILY REMINDER ABOUT YOUR HEALING
Use the alarm feature to remind yourself to consult the app each day. Whether you suffer from depression, psychotic episodes or other psychiatric illness, let the Mental Health Recovery Guide frame your day and guide your healing actions.

• CHANGE YOURSELF, CHANGE THE SYSTEM
MHRG’s approach to mental health is one of self-help — of taking back your power to affect your own positive change.

By using MHRG to take responsibility for your own healing, you will be doing your bit to take the pressure off your country’s resources, thereby saving the NHS, or other healthcare system, money that can be re-deployed to support others like you.

By doing this you can change the system, and yourself.

Download now, and begin.

MENTAL HEALTH RECOVERY GUIDE (MHRG): BEST FEATURES
• 17 ESSENTIAL GUIDELINES: Covering diet, exercise, medication, positive thinking and love.
• SUPER VIEW: Tap any of the guidelines to access expanded info about treatment and self-help remedies.
• COOL STYLE: Information is presented in scrolling sentences of bold yellow type for enhanced impact.
• DAILY REMINDER: Start your day right — set a time to read the app each morning.
• CUSTOMISE YOUR LOOK: Choose from four background colours.

MHRG is free. There are no pop-ups for ads or other purchases. No registration of any kind is required, and there are no requests for users to disclose any information of a personal or confidential nature. 

If you like it, write a review and spread the word to others within the community.

Discover more of our apps at www.365positivity.com

title: UP! - Depression, Bipolar & Borderline Management
description:
UP! is a highly automated mood diary. Track your personal warning signs of depression, mania and hypomania effortlessly when needed. UP! supports you in keeping a daily journal of your emotions and habits in the blink of an eye.  With UP!, managing, monitoring and analyzing symptoms of bpd, depression and bipolar just became easier.

Your Benefits
• Increases your competencies to differentiate between normal mood swings and disease symptoms.
• Sharpens your competencies to recognize early warning signs.
• Supports you to better understand the psychology behind your mood.
• The UP! mood diary is a valuable companion for your psychotherapy.
• Supports a collaborative approach to respond on mental health issues even better.

Trilogic telemedical setup: Share your mood with your therapist & trusted people.
• Document your state of mental health and simply generate reports about the past 14 and 30 days in PDF-Format. Discuss the mood diary in your therapy. You can print or directly send reports using your smartphone. 
• Recommend the UP!Doctor web application to your psychiatrist. Connect to it by using a pairing code. Share information effortlessly.
• Better together: Connect with a trusted person from family & friends using the partner app UP! Buddy.

The UP! Community
The UP! mood diary originally was designed for individuals with bipolar I and bipolar II.  Also, bipolar individuals with rapid cycling and mixed episodes are using the app to document their state of mental health. UP! is also used by people with borderline personality disorder (BPD), cyclothymia and recurrent depression. Since UP! in general is an asset to CBT, the app is also successfully used for other mental health conditions like major and recurrent depression, anxiety & panic attacks and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

Highly automated: UP! – the smart mood diary that writes itself.
• The UP! mood diary automatically keeps journal of your physical activity, your work-life-balance, sleeping habits and your social activity. 
• Your personal early warning signs for hypomania, mania or depression are automatically displayed when you report an unusually depressed or elevated mood to UP!
• UP! provides customizable reminders for the fast mood input option and the detailed diary input option.

Advice for usage:
Become more mindful about your mental balance. UP! is designed to foster self-awareness and patient-empowerment. Use the evening for a detailed diary entry to document your habits and your mood but make this also a routine for introspection. Make use of UP! for self-reflection to better detect the connections between your daily life and hypomania, mania and depression. Identify your mood triggers and develop coping strategies for them. Become aware of negative behavioral patterns and establish positive & healthy new ones. Therefor, team up with a health care professional and share the knowledge and information’s gathered with UP!

The science behind UP!
UP! was developed with scientists to support people who must cope with a bipolar affective disorder (bipolar 1 and bipolar 2).  The app digitizes routines and concepts suggested by supranational treatment guidelines and implicitly implements psycho-educative & cognitive behavioral therapeutically (CBT) approaches.

Your feedback matters to us:
 We need feedback to constantly improve the mood diary. Problems, questions, suggestions, praise and criticism - tell us: info@netural.com

TAKE CARE AND DOWNLOAD NOW!
descriptionHTML:
UP! is a highly automated mood diary. Track your personal warning signs of depression, mania and hypomania effortlessly when needed. UP! supports you in keeping a daily journal of your emotions and habits in the blink of an eye. With UP!, managing, monitoring and analyzing symptoms of bpd, depression and bipolar just became easier.

Your Benefits
• Increases your competencies to differentiate between normal mood swings and disease symptoms.
• Sharpens your competencies to recognize early warning signs.
• Supports you to better understand the psychology behind your mood.
• The UP! mood diary is a valuable companion for your psychotherapy.
• Supports a collaborative approach to respond on mental health issues even better.

Trilogic telemedical setup: Share your mood with your therapist & trusted people.
• Document your state of mental health and simply generate reports about the past 14 and 30 days in PDF-Format. Discuss the mood diary in your therapy. You can print or directly send reports using your smartphone.
• Recommend the UP!Doctor web application to your psychiatrist. Connect to it by using a pairing code. Share information effortlessly.
• Better together: Connect with a trusted person from family & friends using the partner app UP! Buddy.

The UP! Community
The UP! mood diary originally was designed for individuals with bipolar I and bipolar II. Also, bipolar individuals with rapid cycling and mixed episodes are using the app to document their state of mental health. UP! is also used by people with borderline personality disorder (BPD), cyclothymia and recurrent depression. Since UP! in general is an asset to CBT, the app is also successfully used for other mental health conditions like major and recurrent depression, anxiety & panic attacks and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

Highly automated: UP! – the smart mood diary that writes itself.
• The UP! mood diary automatically keeps journal of your physical activity, your work-life-balance, sleeping habits and your social activity.
• Your personal early warning signs for hypomania, mania or depression are automatically displayed when you report an unusually depressed or elevated mood to UP!
• UP! provides customizable reminders for the fast mood input option and the detailed diary input option.

Advice for usage:
Become more mindful about your mental balance. UP! is designed to foster self-awareness and patient-empowerment. Use the evening for a detailed diary entry to document your habits and your mood but make this also a routine for introspection. Make use of UP! for self-reflection to better detect the connections between your daily life and hypomania, mania and depression. Identify your mood triggers and develop coping strategies for them. Become aware of negative behavioral patterns and establish positive & healthy new ones. Therefor, team up with a health care professional and share the knowledge and information’s gathered with UP!

The science behind UP!
UP! was developed with scientists to support people who must cope with a bipolar affective disorder (bipolar 1 and bipolar 2). The app digitizes routines and concepts suggested by supranational treatment guidelines and implicitly implements psycho-educative & cognitive behavioral therapeutically (CBT) approaches.

Your feedback matters to us:
We need feedback to constantly improve the mood diary. Problems, questions, suggestions, praise and criticism - tell us: info@netural.com

TAKE CARE AND DOWNLOAD NOW!
summary: A mood diary for your mental health. Understand the psychology behind your mood.

If you find any strange behavior or bugs please use the feedback functionality within UP! and contact us. That helps a lot to improve! Thank you!
comments: # 1): I have only used this application one time, just a moment ago, and I already like it! The only reason that I'm only giving this app three stars, for now, is for the simple reason that I don't know how well this application helps in long-term care. I believe it's got the potential to be very useful, but until I'm certain, I'm not rating four stars or more. If I find that this app is more useful than I expected, then I'll automatically rate it 4 stars, and possibly 5 stars, later on!

It tends to forget what day it is, so when I put in my sleep it is for the day before, but im trying to do today. And when I change the date it erases the previous day. Its very frustrating. I would like to have another mood meter saying something like mad and cool something like that. My warning signs are being angry, not so much being happy and sad. I had a good day and I put I was happy, and it said it was a warning sign but it wasn't and I put down a sad, and it didn't mark a warning sign.

It's a nice app the only bad thing about it is that you have to pay to look back on your previous months if you want to see if you are improving plus there is no option to send this data to your doctor via email I wish I could effort the pay version but I'm on disability and i have barely enough to survive on

I've only been using this for a week but it's really helping me keep track of moods and taking my medicine. However I do think theres room for improvement I think they should add more moods and allow you to note warning signs even if the server doesn't ask you to, I added an elevated mood and it didn't prompt me to enter warning signs and I can't find a way to manually mark them. Sometimes you have to adjust your sleep times. Otherwise great app!

App will try to force you to use location tracking, which seems absolutely unnecessary to me. Also, when I enter +2 anxiety, -2 energy and -1 self-confidence, it'll still say 'I feel okay', which is obviously not the case. I wish you could enter that yourself as well as the UI doesn't do a proper job with that.

title: Wounded Personalities personality disorders
description:
Wounded Personalities is an educational psychology app which explains and describes the fascinating world of psychiatric personality disorders. The app includes a detailed 80 question user assessment which tests the user for a possible personality disorder.

In the world of psychology and psychiatry, personality disorders are relatively rare conditions affecting approximately nine percent of the adult population. This app explores these disorders and provides definitions, explanations, and even causes for these rare psychiatric disorders.

This app includes:

•	A description and explanation of each of the ten personality disorders
•	A message of caution from the developer
•	A discussion of the possible causes of personality disorders
•	A comprehensive description of PDs by the Mayo Clinic
•	A fascinating take on personality disorders by Dr. Neel Burton.
•	Examples of personality disorders in film and the media
•	The difference between personality disorders and personality traits. 
•	A video on personality disorders by Dr. Todd Grande
•	An 80-question self-assessment for clinical personality disorders.
•	A 25-question test on the user’s knowledge of personality disorders

Several factors put people at a greater risk of developing a personality disorder. These include:

Family histories of mental illness
Growing up in abusive, unstable or chaotic homes
Being diagnosed with a conduct disorder in childhood
Experiencing emotional abuse or neglect as children
Being disciplined in a harsh or inconsistent way as children
Having highly reactive or sensitive temperaments

If you have comments or questions regarding the app feel free to contact us at psycnetsolutions@gmail.com

comments: I am suddenly having issues. I have read several chapters already When I tried to read a chapter today, the chapter was nothing but a white page. What happened? I would like that fixed.
Very informative with straight to the point facts and information. I gave 3 stars because I feel there could be even more informative topics and Intel. An app that good should be even better !!😉

Everything I needed to know... About myself. I believe that this app is really great and insightful on a lot I didn't know on such disorders. Amazed.
Was disappointed in the variety & depth/length of information provided. Very simple & sweet "chapters"

title: Psychopedia
description:
Psychopedia is an application that helps the users to destigmatize mental health conditions and encourage users to seek the help they need.
Mental disorders could be a big issue for your health. Can be caused by lifestyle, stress, diseases, calories, drastic weight loss, family issues, body fitness, etc.
The tests in this app are one of the quickest ways to determine whether you are experiencing symptoms of a specific mental health condition.
In addition, there are helpful articles about mental health conditions, related subjects about relationships, about who you are and how your psyche works.
Take a test and learn more about yourself.

title: InnerHour Self-Care Therapy - Anxiety & Depression
description:
Make self-care a priority with the InnerHour app

Do you want to overcome depression? Beat anxiety? Tackle stress? Or simply feel happier?

The InnerHour app is here to help!

Using their insights from therapy and the latest science in CBT (Cognitive Behaviour Therapy), Positive Psychology, and Mindfulness, our team of psychiatrists and psychologists have replicated the real-life therapy experience into a self-help app for you.

The app is your safe space for self-care, with 300+ therapy-based self-help tools designed for depression, anxiety, stress and other mental health concerns.

▌Six self-help courses

• Depression: Make small changes to overcome depression
• Anxiety: Attain calm with strategies for anxiety relief
• Sleep: Build a sleep schedule and develop habits to sleep better
• Stress: Keep a check on your stress levels to feel in control
• Anger: Channelise your anger and build learn strategies to cool down
• Happiness: Develop critical skills to feel happier in life


▌Personalised 4-week plans

With the help of a scientific assessment, the app will identify your unique mental health needs and build a personalised self-care plan for depression, anxiety, stress & more.

So what does your plan entail?

1. Self-care activities

We have condensed decades of therapy experience and mental health research into simple activities - each teaching a strategy based on CBT, Positive Psychology, or Mindfulness. All you need is 5 minutes each day to work on yourself!

2. Goal setting and tracking

Our goal setting and tracking mechanism will help you build healthy habits that will last a lifetime. With this CBT-inspired feature, stay motivated to meet your physical and mental health goals - be it healthy eating,  exercising or thinking positively.

3. Mood tracking

Check-in with yourself with our specialised tracker! The more you track, the more insights you will get. You can even identify specific emotions and map your mood to different activities you engage in throughout the day.

4. InnerHour Resources

We want you to keep learning on your self-help journey. Our resources include articles, tips, and inspiring quotes to help you stay motivated. For instance, you will:

• Understand the different causes of depression
• Learn about the symptoms of anxiety
• Know how to tell if it’s time to go to therapy

Your self-help plan is a reflection of what happens in real life therapy. Over 4 weeks, we hope to help you practise skills to battle depression, sleep better, get anxiety relief, and ultimately lead an emotionally healthy life.

Your self-care journey doesn’t have to end here…

• Access additional self-help courses

We’ve built shorter courses to offer support for more specific concerns like overthinking, social anxiety, loneliness & more. Just like in therapy, you can work on these specific areas in addition to your main plan.

• Feel less alone with Allie

In times of distress, talk to Allie, our intelligent chatbot. Allie identifies your mental health difficulty at the moment - be it anxiety or depression - and offers simple activities to help you feel calm immediately.

• Find hope, peace & stability during the health crisis

Access our limited-period self-help courses to get emotional support for dealing with the health crisis. You can also talk to Allie if you’re overwhelmed by what’s going on in the world.

Treat yourself to unlimited self-care, starting today.

The InnerHour app is free to download for all. A number of our offerings are available for free, including our Foundation courses, the Relief Bot, Self-Care Goals, the Mood Tracker, and InnerHour Resources.

For any questions, you can reach out to us on support@theinnerhour.com.
Visit our website: https://www.theinnerhour.com/

comments: I love this app! I have been trying to keep my anxiety under control and I came across this app, I only have the free version so far but I can see myself purchasing the extras because its helping me so much! The only complaint I have is the voice recordings crackle midway through and its distracting. If this were fixed it would honestly be the best app I've ever downloaded. Thank you for making this wonderful app!

I tried to get a straightforward answer from them regarding the full set of features and costs for the two paid upgrades (Pro and Plus). After about 20 minutes of feeling like I was talking to a politician with talking points (that is, they just kept dodging the question and repeating answers that did not address what I was asking about), I simply gave up.

So far this app is great! I've only used it for a week or so now, but even just tracking my moods and writing them out helps me release some anxiety. I find the guided exercises helpful in putting my negative thoughts into perspective. I've been recommending this to many of my friends. While it's not a replacement for a therapist, it's a great way to check in with yourself each day. I hope they add therapy sessions outside of India someday! I'm sure it would help a lot of people.

So far I LOVE this app, it has already made a HUGE difference for me. More than anything else I have tried and I have been dealing with the same mental health problems for years and years. I really would love the premium but since the covid pandemic it's basically impossible for me to afford the premium. ☹️ I really wish there was another way for me to get the premium. Thank you SO much for making this app!!

The free services are everything you need except completely personalised options. So its a win in my book already. The bot is well made and is useful wherever you are (I've mostly had to use her in class, it was quick and easy without anyone noticing) Im keeping this app, it hasn't given me any trouble so I'd say if you see this on your for you page or in the search options its completely worth a shot.
